alert.note: Alert for North Beltrami; North Clearwater; South Beltrami (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 2:33PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Beltrami and northern Clearwater Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 232 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over eastern Lower Red Lake, or 35 miles north of Bemidji, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Accumulating small hail is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ponemah around 235 PM CDT. Saum around 250 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Otto, Shotley and Waskish. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: North Beltrami; North Clearwater; South Beltrami
